reviewText: So, if you're a horror collector, this one isn't the worst or anything. It's a bad game, but I didn't find it dull. Some of the sound design was alright, but it's a short experience that doesn't use its cheap qualities well, has a few bugs, and turns out more silly than effective. It re-uses the same puzzle multiple times (and is the only puzzle in the game), there's maybe two encounters with anything threatning, and most of it is just walking around bland-looking environments while spooky sounds happen and you collect things. Still, could of been worse, found myself amused, and for $2 you could do a lot worse, even in the first-person indie horror game scene. Not recommended if you want a good game, and thus why I don't recommend it (much better alternatives), but in the end not offensively bad or anything, more... Silly-bad. Grammar and spelling mistakes up the wazoo, the whole game is about a cursed mirror and you never see the mirror... I don't strongly dislike it, it's not good, and I guess if you really want to experience it, then go for it. Just go in with the expectation that this isn't a good game, and you may have a little dumb fun with it.

reviewText: White Mirror is the third horror title from indie developer M. Yuriy. It centers around a relic hunter who has made it his current task to find a legendary mirror that holds the forces of good and evil. There is little in the way of storytelling throughout the game, save for the introduction and a few notes scattered about, all of which are marred by terrible translation.\n\nWhile this game was made in FPS Creator, the developer has done a great job in creating a creepy atmosphere. The game is dim, dark, and rustic, and the graphics are fairly pleasing to the eye. The soundtrack also keeps an air of tension about, even when there is no present danger. That being said, there's no real horror" to experience except for one tiny jumpscare toward the end of the game
date: but the atmosphere keeps this title afloat. There are a few easy to solve puzzles throughout the short journey
recommended: and only one monster that rears its ugly head. This monster is met in the caves
hoursPlayed: and he's very easily glitched; he will get stuck in one spot
voteText: unable to move
helpfulPercent: leaving you free to bypass him without any hassle.\n\nSpeaking of glitches
votesHelpful: the developer seems to have ironed out most of the concerning bugs that I witnessed in Let's Plays and read in prior reviews. I did not experience any crashing
votesTotal: or game breaking flaws. The game runs at a stable 80 FPS most of the time
votesFunny: however it does have problems rendering the water in the caves; dropping the framerates down to the 50s and 60s. Other than this
commentsCount: there's nothing particularly bad about White Mirror

reviewText:
Pros:
Spooky atmosphere,
Decent looking textures,

Cons:
Broken English,
Sluggish movement,
Sfx are too loud,
No options menu,
Jump key was the number 7 for some reason,

Sum up:
Game was pretty disappointing, exactly what you would expect from a low end indie horror game,
over powered sound effects, lots of spelling and grammar errors, keys and obscure notes everywhere,
not really worth the money with all the free indie horror games out there unless you get it in a bundle.

reviewText: What can I say about this game? It wasn't terrible. It was great by any stretch of the imagination, but I've definitrly played worse. If you've ever been around Game Jolt you know what I'm talking about. This was incredibly short, and really took no thought at all to get through. The hardest part of the game was trying to piece together the ridiculous grammar and broken English. The atmosphere was nice and the textures were pretty good. For two bucks, I'd have to say I got my money's worth, which is the main reason it got a thumbs up.

reviewText: Not... terrible... I beat it in about 40 minutes, would have been 30 if my $2000 PC could handle this intense game *sarcasim*, but serious this game crashed 3 times which was annoying.  Overall not bad, but not great.  It has a nice atmosphere.  The sound could be better, it was creepy, but when the fx came on it was LOUD. Cons... short, not very challenging, and not too many scares, BUT it's $2 so you get what you pay for and for what I paid it wasn't bad.  It's a indie title and the guy didn't do a half bad job. If you're doing a horror game marathon and need something inbetween games then pick this up.\n\nALSO, the grammer in this is HORRIBLE haha not recommended for grammer Nazis.

reviewText: Was given this as a gift, and I have to say, I wasn't disappointed. The story is a bit vague, and the English translation is a bit wonky but those are really the only downsides. The atmosphere is great, has some good, creepy background noise. The puzzles are easy (if you can really call them puzzles). It's just a simple, creepy little exploring game. As I mentioned, the story could have been better, but I enjoyed it just for the setting. As long as you don't expect much from it, you'll enjoy yourself for a bit.

reviewText: My Playthrough - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_6wRq78uOk\nUhh kind of a stupid game. reviewText:
Got My thoughts together - ready to give some feedback

I'm not fan of horror, however this game really did hook Me up.
1) The plot is not from the Christopher Nolan movie but stil decent enough for an indie game.
2) Gameplay is pretty simple, which is good for that kind of game so that You don't get disturbed from the atmosphere.
3) The mentioned atmosphere is 7king horrifying. No spoilers said - it keeps on edge all the time.
4) Graphics is okay, not the best one for 2016 but You don't neet the best in that kind of a game.
5) The price is more than OK.

all things said, I'd recommend to purchase this game for one-time walkthrough, which worth the cost.

now, go find the mirror

reviewText: About White Mirror: So this game starts out at the night, like the most horror genré type of games does, so not much to say there. The game has no options, so whenever you play you gotta learn to play with the settings you have, that might be annoying, but you get used to it fast, the game has some puzzles" which is easy if you know just a bit about puzzles! Also the game has boring clouds

reviewText: The game is really addictive, tense atmosphere, interesting graphics, for this engine, awesome music. But there are also disadvantages, first, the game is quite short,and secondly, scare not everyone, and the game engine will not give the result, which will really make you sweat. If the author will change the engine, then I think the game will have a good future.

reviewText: Okay well I get that this is an early access game and I truly hope that you continue on with it, but there are a few features that need to be implemented into the game. A settings menu would be nice due to the fact that the particles cause me to lose frames drastically. Other than that, so far it is a pretty decent horror game. It has a nice eerie atmospere and looks nice aswell. Just keep with the game and it'll turn out fine.

reviewText: This game surprised me . You know it's something special . Graphics, gameplay ? No ... It's the atmosphere . Good graphics , this game helps to get into it . The gameplay does not get bored. The play of light is doing its job . I'm not talking about an excellent balance of objects. What can we say , you can drink wine! This will give a negative (or positive effect ? ) . I advise everyone !\n\n10 barrels of wine from 10 .
